dk.statsbiblioteket.util.reader
Class StringReplacer

java.lang.Object
  java.io.Reader
      java.io.FilterReader
          dk.statsbiblioteket.util.reader.ReplaceReader
              dk.statsbiblioteket.util.reader.StringReplacer
All Implemented Interfaces:
TextTransformer, java.io.Closeable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Readable
@QAInfo(level=NORMAL,
        state=IN_DEVELOPMENT,
        author="te")
public class StringReplacer
extends ReplaceReader

A reader that replaces Strings on the fly. This replacer uses a tree for finding matches for replacement and should be fairly effective for a large number of replacements, as long as there is a non-trivial amount of diversity among the replacements (e.g. "aaa1" => "foo", "aaa2" => "bar" etc.) will give poor performance when the number of cases is in the hundreds or thousands.

Constructor Detail

StringReplacer

public StringReplacer(java.io.Reader in,
                      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> replacements)
Create a new replacer replacing substrings in the in stream based on the rules defined by the replacements argument.

Parameters:
in - the character stream in which to replace substrings
replacements - the Strings to replace, from target to destination.

StringReplacer

public StringReplacer(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> replacements)
Create a new replacer, with an empty input stream, replacing substrings based on the rules defined by the replacements argument.

Before calling any other methods on this reader you chould set its input stream by calling setSource(java.io.Reader).

Parameters:
replacements - the Strings to replace, from target to destination.
Method Detail

clone

public java.lang.Object clone()
A clone of the StringReplacer will share the rules of the replacer, but will otherwise be independent. A clone will not have a source defined. Creating a clone is very cheap with regard to memory and processing time.

Specified by:
clone in class ReplaceReader
Returns:
a clone of this ReplaceReader.

public char[] transformToCharsAllowInplace(char[] chars)
Description copied from interface: TextTransformer
Transforms an array of chars to an array of chars.

If the transformation results in exactly the same number of chars as the input, it is allowed for the implementation to re-use the input array.
